result.arabic_text: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا
result.translation: Say, “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened [to the Qur’an,] and they said, ‘Indeed, we have heard a wondrous recitation

result.arabic_text: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا
result.translation: that guides to the right way, so we have believed in it, and we will never associate anyone with our Lord.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا
result.translation: And that He – our exalted and glorified Lord[1] – has neither taken a wife nor a child;
result.footnotes: [1] “Jadd” of Our Lord means His Glory, Grandeur, and Command.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
result.translation: and that the fool among us [i.e., Satan] used to say outrageous things about Allah[2],
result.footnotes: [2] i.e., Satan tempted humans to believe that Allah has a wife and children, and that the angels are Allah's daughters.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا
result.translation: although we thought that humans and jinn would never tell lies about Allah.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا
result.translation: And there were some men who used to seek refuge with some jinn, but they only increased them in burden.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا
result.translation: They thought, just like you [jinn] thought that Allah would never send any messenger.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا
result.translation: We have sought to reach heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fire.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
result.translation: We used to take up positions there for eavesdropping, but now anyone who eavesdrops will find a flaming fire waiting for him[3].
result.footnotes: [3] After the Prophet Muhammad (ﷺ) was sent as a messenger, the jinn who used to eavesdrop on heaven and then pass it on to fortune-tellers came to an end.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا
result.translation: We do not know whether evil is intended for those on earth, or their Lord intends good for them.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
result.translation: Among us are some who are righteous and some who are otherwise, for we follow divergent ways[4].

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا
result.translation: We have realized that we can never escape Allah on earth, nor can we ever escape Him by fleeing.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
result.translation: When we heard the guidance [of the Qur’an], we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will have no fear of curtailment [from his reward] or injustice[5].
result.footnotes: [5] i.e., nor will the sins of another be placed upon him.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
result.translation: Among us are some who are Muslims and some who are deviant[6]. Those who accepted Islam have sought the true guidance,
result.footnotes: [6] i.e., deviant from the right way.

result.arabic_text: وَأَمَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُواْ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبٗا
result.translation: but those who are deviant, they will be fuel for Hell.’”

result.arabic_text: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا
result.translation: “If they had remained steadfast on the right way, We would have given them abundant rain,

result.arabic_text: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
result.translation: as a test for them[7]. But whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[8], He will make him suffer an arduous punishment.
result.footnotes:
[7] As to whether they will be grateful for Allah's provisions or not.
 [8] i.e., the Qur’an and obedience to Him.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
result.translation: The mosques[9] are for Allah alone, so do not supplicate anyone along with Allah.
result.footnotes: [9] "Masjid" here means every place of worship on earth.

result.arabic_text: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
result.translation: Yet when the slave of Allah stood up supplicating Him, they swarmed around him[10].”
result.footnotes: [10] Crowding in the manner of locusts on top of one another in order to hear him (ﷺ). It refers to the jinn or to the Arabs pagans.

result.arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا
result.translation: Say [O Prophet], “I only supplicate my Lord and I do not associate anyone with Him.”

result.arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا
result.translation: Say, “I have no power to harm or benefit you[11].”
result.footnotes: [11] i.e., grant you goodness and guidance.

result.arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا
result.translation: Say, “None can ever protect me from Allah [if I should disobey Him], nor can I ever find refuge except in Him.

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا
result.translation: I only convey what I receive from Allah and His messages.” And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger will certainly be in the Fire of Hell, abiding therein forever.

result.arabic_text: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا
result.translation: Until when they see what they were promised, they will realize who is weaker in helpers and fewer in number.

result.arabic_text: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا
result.translation: Say, “I do not know if what you are promised is near or my Lord has appointed a distant time for it.

result.arabic_text: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا
result.translation: [He is] the Knower of the unseen, He does not reveal His unseen to anyone,

result.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
result.translation: except the messenger whom He chooses, then He appoints angel-guards before him and behind him[12]
result.footnotes: [12] Protecting him so that others do not know what he was informed of the unseen.

result.arabic_text: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
result.translation: to ensure[13] that the messengers fully conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses in His knowledge all about them, and keeps count of all things.”
